about.title: Systems Integrator
about.description:
A Systems What?
Working behind the scenes at many company's both large and small, I've done everything from setting up VMs and configuring the operating system. To developing complex systems to transfer data between them. I've also developed multiple browser-based applications that allowed users inside and outside the company to access information from multiple sources in a secure way.

Still confused?
Perhaps this wiki description will describe it better?
A systems integrator (or system integrator) is a person or company that specializes in bringing together component subsystems into a whole and ensuring that those subsystems function together, a practice known as system integration. They also solve problems of automation. Systems integrators may work in many fields but the term is generally used in the information technology (IT) field such as computer networking, the defense industry, the mass media, enterprise application integration, business process management or manual computer programming. Data quality issues are an important part of the work of systems integrators. [link]
